noun.description: A long curved fruit which grows in clusters and has soft pulpy flesh and yellow skin when ripe.
The tropical and subtropical palmlike plant that bears bananas, having very large leaves but lacking a woody trunk.

examples: I've spent two months in a studio—I must be bananas
Roy's customers think the council has gone bananas

phrases: From top banana to bit player - hey, work's work.
The current top banana at Westminster was Porter's golden-boy back in the 80s at the start of his political career.
Fingers are being pointed at the top banana in the Tory campaign, who is an Aussie.
TJ, the top banana of the organisation, the big cheese if you like, will be hosting an open day.
The company is now chaired by the former top banana at Asda, the supermarket chain now controlled by Wal-Mart.
origin: Late 16th century: via Portuguese or Spanish from Mande.
